title: Reorganize active docs into domain-agnostic structure
description:
Reorganize JIT documentation into two clear domains following comprehensive strategy.

**See:** dev/studies/documentation-organization-strategy.md (linked to this issue)

## Overview

Implement Phase 1 of documentation reorganization:
1. **Product documentation** (`docs/`) - Permanent, user-facing, domain-agnostic (Diátaxis framework)
2. **Development documentation** (`dev/`) - Lifecycle-managed, contributor-facing (JIT archival)

This separates "what users need to know" from "how we build it" while maintaining domain-agnostic principles.

## Acceptance Criteria

### 1. Create Directory Structure

```bash
# Product documentation (permanent)
mkdir -p docs/{concepts,tutorials,how-to,reference,case-studies}

# Development documentation (lifecycle-managed)
mkdir -p dev/{active,architecture,vision,studies,sessions}
mkdir -p dev/archive/{features,bug-fixes,refactorings,studies,sessions}
```

### 2. Create Index Files

- `docs/index.md` - Product documentation landing (Diátaxis navigation)
- `dev/index.md` - Development documentation landing

### 3. Move Files to New Structure

**To dev/active/ (linked to active issues):**
- ci-gate-integration-design.md
- gate-examples.md
- observability-design.md
- agent-validation-design.md
- documentation-lifecycle-design.md
- documentation-lifecycle-strategy.md

**To dev/architecture/ (permanent internal reference):**
- design.md → core-system-design.md
- storage-abstraction.md
- web-ui-architecture.md
- graph-filtering-architecture.md
- cli-and-mcp-strategy.md

**To dev/vision/ (future plans):**
- knowledge-management-vision.md
- document-graph-implementation-plan.md

**To dev/studies/ (investigations):**
- architecture-pitfalls.md
- bulk-operations-plan.md
- clippy-suppressions.md
- documentation-organization-strategy.md (already placed)

**To dev/sessions/ (if any exist):**
- session-*.md files

### 4. Configure Archival Policy

Add to `.jit/config.toml`:
```toml
[documentation]
development_root = "dev"
managed_paths = ["dev/active", "dev/studies", "dev/sessions"]
archive_root = "dev/archive"
permanent_paths = ["docs/"]
```

### 5. Update Links

- Update all relative links in moved files
- Update README.md documentation section
- Update CONTRIBUTOR-QUICKSTART.md references
- Update issue document references (jit doc paths)

### 6. Update docs/README.md

Update existing docs/README.md to reflect new structure:
- Add section on docs/ vs dev/ distinction
- Update archival policy (only applies to dev/)
- Add links to dev/index.md

## Success Metrics

- ✅ Clear `docs/` vs `dev/` separation created
- ✅ All files moved to appropriate locations
- ✅ Archival configuration in place (dev/ only)
- ✅ No broken links
- ✅ All issue doc references updated
- ✅ Navigation clear from both docs/index.md and dev/index.md

## Follow-up Issues

After Phase 1 completion, create:
- Phase 2: Create product documentation content (concepts, tutorials, how-tos, reference)
- Phase 3: Extract dogfooding content from README to case studies
